results.title: The Primary cell
results.brief_description: Animation s used to explain the operation of the dry cell in terms of electron action, including ionisation of the electrolyte, electron flow through a circuit, action at electrodes, polarization and depolarisation. Demonstrations reveal the operating characteristics of a cell and of several cells (as in a battery) in both series and parallel connexions.

results.title: The Price of hunger
results.creator_credit: Kent Smith, Barr Films and Kent Smith Studio
results.brief_description: Documents the problem of worldwide hunger, its causes and solutions. Looks at how Third World governments trade the lives and health of their people for personal gain, how Western foreign policy supports corrupt Third World governments and how multinational corporations use business practices which often rob the poor of their land and food. Also shows how improved farming methods not dependent upon extensive energy and technology or foreign investment could help reduce hunger. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Price of fire
results.creator_credit: Bruce Parsons, Tom Daly and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Filmed under great difficulty and risk in Montreal’s worst fire zone, this film argues, in ways no audience can ignore, the case for inspection and prevention. It is a strong reminder of the price of carelessness and the need for vigilance, especially during winter months when fire hazards are at their height.

results.title: The Price of a life
results.creator_credit: Lee R. Bobker, Frank Loveland, American Foundation Institute of Corrections and Vission Associates
results.brief_description: Docudrama which explores probation in the correctional systems in the United States. Traces the entire probation process through the case history of an offender on his way to becoming a habitual criminal. Considers means and methods by which probation can be strengthened and made more effective. A sequel to The Odds Against. Stars Martin Sheen in main role.

results.title: The Presidency: search for a candidate
results.creator_credit: Maurice Schonfeld, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and United Press International Television News
results.brief_description: Every four years the political parties of the United States engage in an internal power struggle in the process of nominating candidates for the presidency. The big effort at the party convention - and in the preconvention campaigns - is to find the man who can win. This film portrays the variety of means a contestant can successfully pursue to become his party’s candidate. Original footage of conventions is used to illustrate the selection process. Narrated by Robert Ryan.

results.title: The Present from Gondwanaland
results.creator_credit: Mike Weatherley and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Up a gum tree”.
Two hundred million years ago the giant continent Gondwanaland split and Australia drifted away. Its plants and animals evolved in isolation from the rest of the world. How does a tree used as a prison fit into the story and what are the secrets of the gum tree’s success? Narrated by David Bellamy.

results.title: The Prefects
results.creator_credit: Brian S Lofts and Phoenix Films
results.brief_description: Prefects at a boys’ school are seen exercising their authority, giving detentions and confiscating articles. They set up a roof garden serving alcohol, complete with a warning device, but when they fail to notice the signal they are caught, demoted and the staff take over the garden, with the boys to serve them.

results.title: The Precursors: Cezanne, Gaugin, Van Gogh
results.creator_credit: Danielle Van De Putte, Pierre Alibert, International Film Bureau and Les Films du Cypres
results.brief_description: Portrays the influence of impressionism as exemplified in Cezanne’s preoccupation with construction, Gauguin’s use of descriptive backgrounds and Van Gough’s attempt to evoke emotion rather than display craftsmanship. Narrated by Phillip Gaunt.
